org.apache.reef.runtime.common.utils

Class DispatchingEStage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.reef.runtime.common.utils.DispatchingEStage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public final class DispatchingEStage
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    Delayed event router that dispatches messages to the proper event handler by type. This class is used in EvaluatorManager to isolate user threads from REEF.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DispatchingEStage(DispatchingEStage other)
      Constructs a DispatchingEStage that uses the Thread pool and ErrorHandler of another one.
      DispatchingEStage(EventHandler<Throwable> errorHandler, int numThreads, String stageName) 

    • Method Summary

      Close the internal thread pool.

      Return true if there are no messages queued or in processing, false otherwise.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DispatchingEStage

        public DispatchingEStage(EventHandler<Throwable> errorHandler,
                 int numThreads,
                 String stageName)
        Parameters:
        errorHandler - used for exceptions thrown from the event handlers registered.
        numThreads - number of threads to allocate to dispatch events.
        stageName - the name to use for the underlying stage. It will be carried over to name the Thread(s) spawned.

      • DispatchingEStage

        public DispatchingEStage(DispatchingEStage other)
        Constructs a DispatchingEStage that uses the Thread pool and ErrorHandler of another one.
        Parameters:
        other -

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public <T,U extends T> void register(Class<T> type,
                            Set<EventHandler<U>> handlers)
        Register a new event handler.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Message type.
        U - Type of message that event handler supports. Must be a subclass of T.
        Parameters:
        type - Message type to process with this handler.
        handlers - A set of handlers that process that type of message.

      • onNext

        public <T,U extends T> void onNext(Class<T> type,
                          U message)
        Dispatch a new message by type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Message type that event handler supports.
        U - input message type. Must be a subclass of T.
        Parameters:
        type - Type of event handler - must match the register() call.
        message - A message to process. Must be a subclass of T.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Return true if there are no messages queued or in processing, false otherwise.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws Exception
        Close the internal thread pool.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        Exception - forwarded from EStage.close() call.
